description: From Middle English betayny, betanie, from Medieval Latin betōnia (possibly through Old French), from Latin betōnica or ve(t)tōnica, from Vettones, a people in Lusitania. Compare French bétoine.

definitionGroups.group: Any plant of the genus Stachys.

entries.meaning: Stachys officinalis (syn. Betonica officinalis, an herb used in traditional European medicine.
(Canada, US) Any plant of the genus Pedicularis (louseworts).
